name: Male feet pose
description:
Lora model for male pose with bare feet (trained with SD1.5), focused on realistic style.
Recommended settings v2:

  • Lora weight: 0.8 - 1.0

  • Image dimentions: 768x786 and other square format is preferred

  • prompt example: a photo of handsome man showing his feet, foot_focused, wearing black boxer-shorts, green field photo, sitting in wild grass field, feet up, barefoot, toes, soles, long legs, bent knees, spread legs pose, composition is awesome <lora:footpose-v2:0.8>

  • CFG scale: ~7

  • negative prompt example: (low quality, worst quality), (bad anatomy), (inaccurate limb:1.2), bad composition, inaccurate eyes, extra digit, fewer digits, (extra arms:1.2), legs crossed

Tested with Adobi's Real Flexible Mix and Something. Should be more consistent then v1.

Recommended settings v1:

  • Lora weight - 1.1 ±0.1

  • prompt: (feet, soles, toes, feet up, man, barefoot, sitting,view from below)

  • CFG scale - 7

  • negative prompt: (low quality, worst quality:1.4), (inaccurate limb:1.2), bad composition, extra digit, fewer digits

Tested with hyperV1_v10 model. This Lora is far from perfect, but it can give some good results.

meta.prompt:
Hyper-realistic shot, Majestic raw portrait photograph of a spain policeman , in chair,(pants, jacket,barefoot, feet, soles, toes, average feet, in police station department, long legs, calf muscles), hands up, thoughtful look, natural shot, shot on a professional camera, HDR, soft and warm lighting, detailed and realistic gear, HD wallpaper, UHD image,  nice sitting pose, impressive manner. He had alert eyes and strong figure with a proud manner. It made him a fine picture of a guardian of peace.Detective John Steel was a hard-boiled cop with a soul as dark as the city streets he patrolled. His weathered face showed the toll of years of fighting crime and corruption. Prominent shadows hung under his cynical eyes, and a network of scratches and scars mapped his stubborn jaw.
He usually dressed in battered black leather, from his knee-high boots to his spine-crushing jacket. An old tie hung loose around his neck, and the cuffs of his shirt were stained with residue from a thousand crime scenes. Steel hated the changing fashions and political correctness of the modern police force. He did things the old way, by instinct and force.
Steel walked with a limp, a memento from a shootout years ago. But it didn't slow him down. If anything, the pain drove him harder. He worked deeper into the night than the younger cops, following leads they were too soft to pursue. Justice was Steel's only motivation in a world where goodness seemed far too fragile. He was a throwback to a grittier time, a last bastion of honor in a sea of corruption. Detective John Steel would stop at nothing to bring the guilty to justice.   <lora:feetpose-v1:1.1>

meta.prompt:
Hyper-realistic shot, Majestic raw portrait photograph of a spain policeman , in chair,(pants, jacket,barefoot, feet, soles, toes, average feet, in police station department, long legs, calf muscles), hands up, thoughtful look, natural shot, shot on a professional camera, HDR, soft and warm lighting, detailed and realistic gear, HD wallpaper, UHD image,  nice sitting pose, impressive manner. He had alert eyes and strong figure with a proud manner. It made him a fine picture of a guardian of peace.Detective John Steel was a hard-boiled cop with a soul as dark as the city streets he patrolled. His weathered face showed the toll of years of fighting crime and corruption. Prominent shadows hung under his cynical eyes, and a network of scratches and scars mapped his stubborn jaw.
By the time Steel limped into his apartment, exhaustion had seeped into his bones. All he wanted was to relax in his favorite old chair, a battered leather armchair that had supported him through countless long nights. The chair sat in a small, dimly lit living room. Not much had changed about the place over the years. A few bookshelves held books on crime and punishment, stacks of unopened mail piled up on a rickety side table. An old television silently gathered dust.
This was Steel's refuge, away from the watchful eyes of colleagues and superiors. Here he could shed the grim facade and let his tiredness show. The chair creaked softly as he shifted, the only sound breaking the heavy silence.
His mind wandered to old cases, cold cases, the ones that still haunted him. So many criminals still roamed free, for lack of evidence or witness courage. So much injustice, and little redemption. <lora:feetpose-v1:1.1>
